list_definition.mean_english: vị ngon; mùi thơm; mùi vị

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The tea has a wonderful flavour/flavor.
The dish has a slightly Eastern flavour/flavor to it.

list_definition.mean_english: cho gia vị; thêm gia vị

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She flavoured/flavored the cake with lemon.

list_ex_of_english: I will focus on two discrete arguments in order to suggest the flavour of the work.
Any volume of this kind, because of its provenance, is bound to have an eclectic flavour.
We try to give a flavour of an exciting but hazardous world at the forefront of live laptop performance.
Sufficient of the flavour of this volume has been given to confirm its difference from the first.
Publicity around the star's feistiness offstage lent the flavour of autobiography to the twice-daily action onstage.
Worsteds became the flavour of the year in 1622.
Pasture feeding - a contribution of additional flavour nuances of milk fat and meat flavour.
This renders the spatial conditioning of an orange flavour perplexing.
